question.title: Android: Activity Window Died (WINDOW DIED) on 4.0.4 ICS Devices

node.contents: Looking at the log and description, I wonder if the problem is related to hardware acceleration (there is some [description here](http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/graphics/hardware-accel.html)). Do you mind checking whether adding `android:hardwareAccelerated="false"` in your manifest makes any difference?

astNode.text: Looking at the log and description, I wonder if the problem is related to hardware acceleration (there is some [description here](http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/graphics/hardware-accel.html)). Do you mind checking whether adding `android:hardwareAccelerated="false"` in your manifest makes any difference?

node.contents: To clarify, my suggestion is to add `hardwareAccelerated="false"`. Just in case you added "true" instead :)

astNode.text: To clarify, my suggestion is to add `hardwareAccelerated="false"`. Just in case you added "true" instead :)

node.contents: @Luke Taylor nothing related to AlertDialog..The issue is random..if i use application fast doing all operation i get into this state..@ Joe i Did try android:hardwareAccelerated = ture But no Use!!

astNode.text: @Luke Taylor nothing related to AlertDialog..The issue is random..if i use application fast doing all operation i get into this state..@ Joe i Did try android:hardwareAccelerated = ture But no Use!!

node.contents: I think I got a similar error once, I think the problem was, that I had an AlertDialog open, and I called finish on the Activity without dismissing the window first. Your problem might be something similar to this?

astNode.text: I think I got a similar error once, I think the problem was, that I had an AlertDialog open, and I called finish on the Activity without dismissing the window first. Your problem might be something similar to this?

node.contents: @Joe Till date i am not using target Attribute in Manifest..min is 8..But when i used hardwareAccelerated="false" with target as 14.. Issue was seen frequently ;( ;( !!

astNode.text: @Joe Till date i am not using target Attribute in Manifest..min is 8..But when i used hardwareAccelerated="false" with target as 14.. Issue was seen frequently ;( ;( !!

node.contents: I see, sorry it didn't help. The only other suggestion that I can think of is to check if you have any custom widget/views that implement its own `onDraw()` method and see if commenting out those will make a difference.

astNode.text: I see, sorry it didn't help. The only other suggestion that I can think of is to check if you have any custom widget/views that implement its own `onDraw()` method and see if commenting out those will make a difference.

node.contents: NitZ, [the default is "true" if you set either minSdkVersion or targetSdkVersion to "14"](http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/application-element.html#hwaccel) or higher, so you should try it with "false".

astNode.text: NitZ, [the default is "true" if you set either minSdkVersion or targetSdkVersion to "14"](http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/application-element.html#hwaccel) or higher, so you should try it with "false".
